meanings.definition: To make null or void; annul
meanings.sent1: The judge disannuls the unfair decision.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer disannuls the contract due to a mistake.
meanings.sent3: The magic spell disannuls the evil curse.
meanings.sent4: The storm disannuls all signs of a peaceful day.
meanings.sent5: The eraser disannuls the pencil marks completely.

meanings.sent2: The bank disannuls the fraudulent transaction.
meanings.sent3: The computer virus disannuls all saved data.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain disannuls the outdoor event.
meanings.sent5: The teacher disannuls the wrong answer and provides the correct one.
